content.p: In this family-friendly talk, Sara L. Goodacre will reveal how spiders use their amazing skills, and explain what it is that we still don’t quite understand about them. Sara will also tell us how spiders give us the template to make our own, artificial spider silk copies that could one day be used to help our own bodies to heal! This lively family talk will take you on a scientific journey with plenty of interactive demonstrations and activities, and is designed to be enjoyed by adults and children together. Times: The talk will begin at 1pm, with free drop-in themed activities available from 12noon to 1pm and 2pm and 3pm Tickets: £3 admission, concessions free. Visit the Lakeside Arts Box Office for tickets. Age range: Suitable for ages 7-11 This event is part of the Bright Sparks family talk series. This series features interactive talks and demonstrations by enthusiastic academics from the University of Nottingham, eager to share their research and passions with family audiences. These lively, hour-long talks provide an insight into our world of research, while providing the opportunity to enjoy free drop-in science activities before and after each performance.
